question: Which of the following best explains the meaning of Fawazil in the Sultanate period?
option1: Extra payment made to the nobles
option2: revenue assigned in lieu of salary
option3: excess amount paid to the exchequer by the iqtadars
option4: illegal exactions extracted from the peasants
answer: excess amount paid to the exchequer by the iqtadars
explanation: Fawazil was the excess amount paid to the exchequer by the Iqtadars in the Sultanate period. Fawazil was balance between the income and expenditure of Iqta-holders.
